author: Richard Innes
title: Nathan Ake's Chelsea return puts inadvertent transfer embargo on thousands of fantasy football managers
text:
Sport Nathan Ake's Chelsea return puts inadvertent transfer embargo on thousands of fantasy football managers For a LOT of fantasy managers, the news Nathan Ake is being recalled to Chelsea from Bournemouth is going to cause some serious headaches Share Nathan Ake just made life very complicated for a lot of people (Photo: Offside Sports Photography) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Antonio Conte's decision to recall Nathan Ake from his loan spell at Bournemouth creates problems for a few people. 
Chelsea defenders Gary Cahill and Marcos Alonso will be nervously wondering if their places in the first team are under threat. Eddie Howe will be contemplating how he replaces the Dutchman, who had been a key part of his Bournemouth side this season. 
But the group who have been most inconvenienced by Ake's return to Stamford Bridge? Fantasy football managers. Nathan Ake, the subject of some obscure fantasy laws (Photo: PA Wire) 
Most aficionados of the fantasy world play Fantasy Premier League, a game that currently features a huge total of 4,305,737 managers. 
One of the key rules of FPL states that you can only pick three players from any Premier League club. At the moment, 9.9 percent of all managers have Ake in their team right now - that equates to 430,000 people who have selected the (until very recently) Bournemouth man. 
Now consider how many managers already have multiple Chelsea players in their side. 44.4 percent of teams include Diego Costa. 34.2 percent have Eden Hazard. 21 percent have Cesar Azpilicueta. 15.4 percent have Thibaut Courtois. Two men very popular with fantasy managers (Photo: Getty) 
That means there are an awful lot of teams which already feature the maximum of three Chelsea players - and presumably a lot of team which already have three Chelsea players AND Nathan Ake in their line-up. 
So, what happens to those teams when Ake suddenly switches from being a Bournemouth player to being a Chelsea player? 
According to the official FPL rules, it appears that they will effectively be put under a transfer embargo. The key rule (Photo: Fantasy Premier League) 
The rules state that: 
If a player is transferred to another team in the Premier League, and this transfer takes you over the players per team limit, then you will need to go back under the limit when making your next transfers. 
So, if you already have Ake and three Chelsea players in your side, you could actually get away with keeping them all… you just wouldn't be able to make another transfer. 
Sounds a lot like a transfer embargo to us… Like us on Facebook
